job_descriptions: Job Description Summary In this role, you will design, develop and provide support for various data systems (based on both traditional RDBMS and big data platform) in Prudential Singapore. As part of this dynamic role, you will report to Lead System Analyst, and work closely with business units and other IT teams to deliver leading edge technology to enable digital capabilities of Prudential Singapore.  Analyse business needs in order to design, develop and deliver data solutions to meet business objectives Provide application maintenance and support for various data systems in accordance to Service Level Agreement Deliver data solutions in accordance to relevant IT policies and procedures Provide and share knowledge to other team members
job_requirements: RequirementsCompetencies & Personal Traits    Independent and works well across different functions   Excellent problem analysis skill. Innovative and creative in developing solutions   Strong sense of drive and commitment to deliver on responsibilities   Strong verbal and written communication skills   Works well in a dynamic environment   Ability and willingness to be hands-on   Experience in 2 or more of the following technology:     RDBMS: Oracle, Postgres, MSSQL, Netezza ETL and Data Integration Tools:  IBM Datastage, Pentaho, Talend, Attunity BI Tools: PowerBI, Qlik Big Data: Hadoop (Hortonworks), Hive QL, Spark, Sqoop, etc Programming and Scripting: Linux/Unix Shell Scripting, Java, Scala, Hive QL, PL/SQL, NoSQL      Working Experience:    2-8 years in designing and developing and support applications. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply   Experience in Agile software development    Education    Bachelor in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent

job_descriptions: Responsibilities As a Lecturer, your contributions go beyond teaching and facilitating learning. You play a critical role in recognising and nurturing your students’ potential and their lifelong learning needs. In addition, you will carry out industry or consultancy projects to help you remain relevant in your profession and to evolving changes in industry, and maintain strong linkages with industry and schools. You will also have the opportunity to have industry attachments or experience on a regular basis to update your skills, knowledge and practices of your profession. Those with good and relevant experience can look forward to Senior Lecturer or equivalent positions, with career development opportunities to leadership positions in the Colleges or Headquarters. Requirements  College Central  You should be trained in Information Technology, Computer Science or Software Engineering, with at least 3 years of relevant work experience in Web/Mobile applications development, Content Management System or IT related field. You should be competent with Adobe CC applications and have good programming skills in iOS programming (SWIFT), C#, PHP, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, Python. Candidates with experience and/or IT certifications in areas of Data Analytics, Internet of Things (IoT), or Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) will have an advantage College East You should be trained in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Science and/or Analytics, with at least 3 years of relevant work experience to be able to develop students' skills in implementing IoT/software applications, including data analytics solutions. You should possess relevant experience in one or more of the following areas: - development of IoT applications - data analytics technologies and Big Data - proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R or similar (familiarity with Python-based libraries such as scikit-learn, numpy/scipy and pandas is preferred) - programming web and mobile applications would be advantageous  College West You should be trained in Information Technology, Computer Science or Software Engineering, with at least 3 years of relevant work experience in Web/Mobile applications development, Content Management System or IT related field. You should be competent with Adobe CC applications and have good programming skills in iOS programming (SWIFT), C#, PHP, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and Python. Candidates with experience and/or IT certifications in areas of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML), Blockchain, Data Analytics, Cloud Computing or Internet of Things (IoT) will have an advantage.

job_titles: Research Assistant / Research Associate / Postdoctoral Fellow / Research Fellow
job_descriptions: Research Fellow/Postdoctoral Fellow, Research Associate and Research Assistant  For “Healthcare Artificial Intelligence and Data Analytics” The above positions are now available to support the Principal Investigator, Assistant Professor Feng Mengling, for his research in the areas of healthcare data analytics and AI solutions.   Dr. Mengling Feng (http://web.mit.edu/mfeng/www/) is truly a cross-disciplinary scientists, who is currently a faculty member of the School of Public Health, School of Computing and School of Medicine, National University of Singapore (NUS). He is also the Senior Assistant Director working directly with the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) and Chief Medical Information Officer (CMIO) at National University Hospital (NUH). Dr. Feng is also an affiliated scientist with MIT. His research is to develop effective data analysis and machine learning methods to extract actionable knowledge from medical big data to improve the quality of care. Dr. Feng’s work was recognized by both well-established journals, such as Science Translational Medicine, and top international conferences, such as KDD, AAAI and AMIA.   Cross-disciplinary and International AI Lab The selected candidates will be working in a cross-disciplinary team consists of data scientists, physicians, post-docs, PhD students and well respected faculty members from NUS, NUH and SGH. The candidates will be working on healthcare projects funded by our Ministry of Health, Health Promotion Board and AI Singapore. As Dr. Feng is an affiliated scientist, his lab constantly work with faculties and students from the Harvard-MIT Health Science Technology division. Dr. Feng has over 10 joint publications with Harvard and MIT between 2017 and 2018. He has also been organizing the annual NUS-MIT Healthcare AI Datathon (www.nus-datathon.com).   Potential Industrial and Overseas Exposure Dr. Feng also collaborates closely with various local and international industrial partners. Therefore, members in Dr. Feng’s team often have opportunities to work as affiliated scientists in our partnering companies, such as MSD, IBM, SAP, Philips, local and international start-ups.
job_requirements: RequirementsMajor responsibility of the selected candidate is to apply and develop machine learning and AI technologies to solve healthcare challenges raised by our clinical collaborators. The selected candidate will also be involved in managing, extracting and pre-processing data for various projects. Required personal skills:  An independent and self-driven worker and a fast learner Well- organized and has an eye for details Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work effectively with colleagues to achieve team goals    Essential technical skills:    Excellent academic record Knowledge and experience in statistical analysis or machine learning Programing language: Python or R or C++     Good proficiency and experience in the following areas is a plus:  Experience with the PL-SQL/Trans-SQL Knowledge and experience in GPU-based computation Strong in Mathematics    This position will be initially available for one year. The grade of appointment will be accorded based on candidate’s academic qualifications and years of relevant experience. Recruitment is open immediately, and will continue until the positions are filled. Interested applicants should send the following documents:  Cover letter highlighting career goals and relevant experience Curriculum Vitae, containing details of three named referees

job_descriptions: Problem solver with curious mindset with a high execution bias having relevant work experience in Data Science in engineering domain. Data scientist with hands on expertise in building and executing analytics modules on various technology platforms including big data technology platforms. Own and complete work streams from business levers, domain know-hows and bias for execution and delivery. Be able to compile results from various work streams and be able to make coherent presentations to internal and external stakeholders. Experience in building or managing data products, high performer and problem solver. Applying best practices to manage solution implementations including code design and reviews
job_requirements: Requirements Sound knowledge of machine learning concepts. Illustrative machine learning methodologies are: 	 Bagging, Boosting, Regularization, Online Learning, One Hot Encoder etc. Statistical modeling - CHAID, CART, Regressions, SVM, SVD etc. Experience on the text analytics stack - NLP, NLU, LDA, TF-IDF etc.   Ability to communicate analytics-based insights to business stakeholders. Independent problem solver comfortable to work in an ambiguous solution space. Strong PPT Skills, Excel Demonstrated experience in delivering analytics projects in high pressure environments MS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or a related field with solid exposure to Machine Learning and/or Advanced Analytics with 5+ years of experience in predictive analytics and exposure to big data analytics. MBAs with relevant data science skills will also be considered. Strong understanding of the electrical engineering domain. Strong coding skills in Python is a must, and in other languages like R and SQL, Hive Sql Hands-on experience with Python libraries - NumPy, Pandas, sklearn Hands-on knowledge of working with scalable platforms for processing large and/or complex multi-source data sets using Hive, Hadoop or Spark (PySpark) is a plus. Comfortable with working on Unix, Windows and databases like Elastic Search and MongoDB Demonstrated the use of data optimization (Linear/Non-linear) to solve constrained business problems Comfortable with working on Unix, Windows and databases like Elastic Search and MongoDB

job_descriptions: The School of Humanities invites application for the position of Research Fellow.   Responsibilities The successful applicant will work on technical and computational aspects of the project, that will allow us to investigate the nature of multi-lingual language mixes in Singapore during the early stages of language acquisition in Singapore. This will include: big data approaches to complex linguistic datasets, design and analysis of linguistic databases, design of advanced scripting for data analysis of behavioural and brain imaging data, design and implementation of in-house app development and scripts for experimental studies. Contributing to the technical aspects of day-to-day running of the lab will also include…  Creating and maintaining a participants’ database Managing and storing data Managing the teams’ shared folder system Administration and maintenance of an online server   The position is ideal for a postdoctoral researcher with solid programming skills and an active interest in cognitive and data science.
job_requirements: RequirementsJob requirements  PhD in Psychology, Cognitive Science, Linguistics, Computer science, Knowledge Engineering or equivalent work experience Experience in big data analytics or high-level computational linguistics A friendly manner, excellent communication (verbal & written English) and interpersonal skills High degree of responsibility and maturity Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Interest in computational linguistics Familiarity with Unix, Windows, Mac OS; standard office software Task-orientation, excellent organisational skills, attention to details and accuracy.   Desirable characteristics Candidates should highlight relevant previous experiences in a cover-letter, where they are encouraged to note their area of expertise (e.g., doctoral dissertation, relevant post doctoral research) and experience in any of the following domains:  Designing and managing databases Statistical data analysis Commitment to Open Science practices Web design/game design/app design Cloud-based team collaboration tools Translation/transcription/teaching  Please send questions and expressions of interest to leap@ntu.edu.sg   We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_descriptions: Are you passionate about open source software? We want to meet you today! We are building Ocean Protocol, a decentralised data exchange protocol to unlock data, particularly for AI. We are looking for a talented and well-rounded Javascript developer to contribute to the design of a fully working reference implementation of Ocean Protocol. You will be working with a team to implement a vibrant ecosystem of Open Source data services that can be used to create trusted, decentralised supply chains for Big Data and AI. Ocean Protocol is designed for scale and uses blockchain technology that allows data to be shared and sold in a safe, secure and transparent manner. Read more about Ocean Protocol and the full technical whitepaper here: https://oceanprotocol.com
job_requirements: RequirementsWhat you’ll be doing:  Support the evolution of the Ocean Protocol in tandem with the reference implementation through public Ocean Enhancement Proposals (OEPs) Develop the working Ocean Reference Implementation in JavaScript according to the specified OEPs Ensure the decentralised Ocean Network V1 launch is fully compatible with the reference implementation Working together with a dedicated UI/UX team to create high quality interfaces Engage effectively with other Ocean development teams to ensure development and implementation is in line with the overall objectives and goals Support usage of the Reference Implementation by partners and early adopters of the Ocean Protocol  Who you might be:  Experience in Agile / iterative product development Passion for Open Source technology with a track record of strong open source contributions Strong technical communication skills    Your technical skillset:  Degree in computer science, engineering or a similar field Highly skilled in JavaScript 5+ years software development experience with a focus on both front-end and backend development Experience with one or more Single Page Application frameworks (e.g. React, Angular or Vue) Experience with the NodeJS ecosystem Knowledge of web services, APIs and JSON Understanding of the entire web development process (design, development and deployment) in a serverless environment Experience with web3 / Metamask / blockchain development strongly preferred

job_titles: Business Analyst (NTUC First Campus, Data Analytics)
job_descriptions: COMPANY DESCRIPTION  NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The Analytics Centre transforms big data into actionable insights which enable the SEs to make decision that directly impact the outcomes of their business.   By identifying patterns and building models that help to interpret and predict the behaviors of different customer segments, we will uncover opportunities for partners to grow their business through more effective marketing, better product development and stronger customer engagement.  We are on the lookout for talented individuals to join us as Business Analysts. This role will work very closely with NTUC First Campus Corporate Development team, which is responsible for development and delivery of data analytics solutions to the organization. As a thought and practice leader in the early childhood care and education field, NTUC First Campus (NFC) has been partnering working families to fulfil the promise of young children since 1977. We believe that every child, from every background, deserves opportunity to enjoy a high quality early childhood education for a good start in life. NFC is one of the largest operator of preschool services in Singapore with more than 160 centres and 4,500 staff. Its portfolio of brands includes My First Skool, The Little Skool-House International and The Catepillar’s Cove. NFC also support the development of early childhood educators through its training institute (SEED) Other services include school-based student care services through its afterschool brand and parenting programs through its Parent’s College unit. NFC seeks to leverage on its analytics capabilities to deliver better outcomes for parents, children and staff as to further its social mission. Responsibilities:    Work closely with business units and corporate functions to understand priorities and develop analytical models to generate actionable insights that help inform those business decisions Works with team leaders and members to solve client analytics problems and documents results and methodologies Retrieve and clean data to make it usable from a variety of sources (and formats) Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses. Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples Present the results using visualization tools to stake holders Make and present clear, data-driven, and actionable, recommendations to the business on new initiatives and areas for potential improvement Work closely with the Centralized Analytics Center to inculcate best practices and standardize analytic approach
job_requirements: Requirements  Master/Bachelor in Statistics, Data Analytics, Computer Science At least 2 years of relevant experience Experience using SQL and Tableau dashboarding Advanced statistical techniques along with at least one of: R, Python, or similar is a plus

job_descriptions: Company & Business Area Description:  Veracity is a unit headquartered in Høvik, Norway. Head of Veracity Global reports to CEO of DNV GL Digital Solutions. The unit’s mission is to develop, operate and attract customers to an open and secure multisided data platform named after one the 4 Vs of Big Data: Volume, Velocity, Variety and Veracity and through this build a sizeable platform business for DNV GL adding value to DNV GL’s core industry ecosystems. Digital Hub, Asia is a unit established in Singapore reporting to CEO of DNV GL Digital Solutions. This unit functions both as a vertical and horizontal and is serving the Maritime, Oil & Gas and Energy industries (DNV GL’s core industry ecosystems). Its current core capabilities are Digital Development and Cyber Security. In the current start-up phase of both units, the main customers are primarily asset owners, data and analytics providers and DNV GL’s business areas serving the Maritime, Oil and Gas and Energy industries. While both units are working together already, we believe that unlocking the substantial market potential for Veracity in Asia – alone or in combination with services provided by the Digital Hub, requires a local presence of a Head of Veracity APAC.  Local Unit & Position Description:  We are searching for a highly motivated individual to take on the position as Head of Veracity APAC to work on increasing number of opportunities in the Asia market. You hold the personality, skills, courage and motivation to meet with newly appointed CDOs, well-established CIOs or Technical managers or other senior managers from DNV GL’s core industries and others. You enjoy, discussing and educating them on how platform solutions and data can remove costly friction and unlock the potentials of data residing in silos. You are a team player striving to maximise the success of the overall operation. You are driven by achieving your goals and you are willing to support your colleagues from the Digital Hub, Asia and/or other Business Areas in the development of business opportunities that are build on or around Veracity. We are looking for a candidate who will drive platform uptake and commercial growth for Veracity in Asia, utilizing the synergies of collaboration with the Digital Hub, Asia where beneficial for the client. The Digital Hub, Asia team consists of about 30 dedicated entrepreneurs from the Business Areas Digital Solutions (core team), Maritime, Oil & Gas and Energy and has a wealth of complimentary talents & skill sets. The Veracity unit headquartered in Høvik, Norway, consists of about 70 dedicated employees and consultants, ranging from developers and IT architects to project managers, marketing and commercials. The position is located within the Digital Hub, Asia in Singapore and reports to Regional Manager Digital Hub, Asia with a dotted line to Veracity in Norway and its Global Head. Areas of responsibility include, but are not limited to:  Responsible for target, prioritize and execute sales to ensure platform uptake towards industry players - in close cooperation with Digital Hub, Asia and the other DNV GL Business Areas; Manage and coordinate sales funnel and CRM process and systems in close cooperation with the other platform departments; Measure and monitor customer success, capture and recommend future platform functionality and capability building of Veracity from Singapore Accountable for reaching individual platform revenue and other uptake target KPIs
job_requirements: RequirementsPosition Qualifications:   You have a broad and in-depth knowledge of one or more of DNV GL’s core business processes and systems/IT architecture and can understand both our customers in-built inefficiencies, and where digital and platform enabled assurance services/solutions will drive down costs; You understand the cash flow and “power balances” between companies and industry bodies in one or more of DNV GL’s core industries, minimum in the Maritime industry; You have minimum 5 years of relevant experience from one or more of our key industries, preferably from customer facing positions within assurance services; Background, network and high credibility among senior stakeholders in assurance industries and internally in DNV GL; Experience from one or more of the following areas is a benefit:   Complex issue-based sales processes and proposal writing involving multi-disciplinary technical and management deliveries Digital platforms and development of digital services value propositions CRM tools, Salesforce and/or Oracle is an advantage    Personal Qualifications: We acknowledge that we ask for much in the position qualifications. Being a customer driven technology junkie with seniority and network in addition to be a fast learner who is eager to dive into platform business dynamics and deliver impact, is equally important.  We are looking for a new colleague with the following personal qualities:  You want to make an impact and is ready to go the extra mile to make it happen You are a team player with an entrepreneurial mindset, agile, self-driven and thrive for opportunities to put your skills and personality to use creating customer value and DNV GL impact You are a believer in the power of technology and understand how it transforms our industries and customer’s business models You are structured, flexible and result oriented You have excellent communication skills, verbally and written, and are a quick learner You understand the importance of collaboration and utilizing personal networks, and are willing and able to travel You are sociable, creates a good atmosphere and recognize that feedback is the fuel of high performing teams

job_descriptions: Want to empower people with data exchange? We are looking for a senior software architect to lead the design of a fully working reference implementation of Ocean Protocol. Our vision is to provide a vibrant ecosystem of Open Source data services that can be used to create trusted, decentralised supply chains for Big Data and AI. The Ocean Protocol is designed for scale and uses blockchain technology that allows data to be shared and sold in a safe, secure and transparent manner.   Your new role:  Drive the evolution of the Ocean Protocol in tandem with the reference implementation through public Ocean Enhancement Proposals (OEPs) Lead an Agile team creating the Ocean Reference implementation according to the specified OEPs Ensure the decentralised Ocean Network V1 launch is fully compatible with the reference implementation Engage effectively with other Ocean development teams to ensure design and implementation is in line with the overall objectives and goals Build external partnerships and help develop the broader Ocean Ecosystem using the Reference Implementation  Ocean Protocol is designed for scale and uses blockchain technology that allows data to be shared and sold in a safe, secure and transparent manner. To read more about Ocean Protocol, and the full technical, business and marketplace whitepapers, please visit https://oceanprotocol.com/
job_requirements: RequirementsWho you are:  Strong experience with Big Data, data engineering, and cloud-based data services Previous working experience as a software architect for data solutions Experience in leading Agile / iterative product development Passion for Open Source technology Outstanding communication, presentation, and leadership skills  Your technical skill set:  Degree in computer science, engineering or a similar field Strong experience in software architecture and API / protocol design 5+ years software development experience Experience with Java, Python and/or Clojure application development

companys: LAZADA SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
job_descriptions: Team Introduction Launched in 2012, Lazada Group has grown rapidly to include over 4.900 full-time employees in the region, with eCommerce operations in Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and a sourcing center in China that drives cross-border marketplace activities, Lazada helps more than 80,000 local and international sellers as well as 2,500 brands serve the 560 million consumers in the region through its marketplace platform, supported by a wide range of tailored marketing, data, and service solutions. Lazada offers an excellent customer experience through a wide network of logistics partners and its own first- and last-mile delivery arm.  Revolutionizing the way customers shop in Southeast Asia and perform online transactions across the region, Lazada has reached an online footprint of approximately 6 million unique daily visits to its websites, and the largest Facebook community in Southeast Asia with over 16.5 million fans.  Lazada Group owns the biggest and the most efficient technology driven logistics and fulfilment ecosystem in the region – Lazada eLogistics. With 11 own warehouses, 5 sorting centers, 78 last-mile hubs we are ensuring 48 hours delivery of more than 6 million orders every month. Our warehouses cover more than 115 thousands of square miles and it takes less than 2 hours to process every order even during massive sales campaigns. Having our own cross-border operator helps us connect more than 100 million of customers and businesses from all over Asia. Our transportation is driven by our own Lazada Express delivery fleet which, together with more than 80 third-party logistics, guarantees high quality 48 hours delivery. All of that would be impossible without sophisticated IT systems, which are being developed and expanded in-house by one of the most experienced and agile tech teams in Southeast Asia! The Role  Work closely with data scientists to productionize machine learning models and build highly scalable APIs Build or customize machine learning models to suit the project requirements Build data pipelines using big data tools to ensure timely data delivery for your projects Collaborate with team members to build reusable components and improve software engineering practises in the team
job_requirements: Requirements Bachelor's or Master's degree preferably in computer science or related field Understanding of machine learning algorithms, deep learning and big data processing tools Exposure to big data tools like Hive, Spark, Map Reduce Proven work experience delivering software projects preferably server side or backend development Solid understanding of data structures and algorithms, concepts like concurrency, no-sql databases etc. 2+ years of experience in Java. Good understanding of Python and SQL Understanding of object oriented programming and design concepts

job_descriptions: Demonstrate and communicate a passion for building the data foundation, products and capabilities that drive business growth · Create data segmentation and modelling · Build innovative data products (e.g., Artificial Intelligence, real-time services, such as personalisation and commerce graphing using Big Data platforms with real-time data ingestion and processing) · Execute descriptive analyses, ranging from identifying product opportunities to understanding user behaviour
job_requirements: RequirementsTechniques like: Statistics based Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Graph Theory · Cloud Architecture background · One or more programming languages like Python, Java, R, or Scala · Delivering data science components that are part of successful commercial products · Collaborating with engineering teams to develop prototypes and software products that can be deployed across varied environments (e.g.: cloud, on-premises, devices, etc.) · Big Data and Fast Data (i.e.: real time streaming)

job_descriptions: Your missions will be: - Design Big Data architectures and infrastructures - Supervise data engineers and data scientists in their implementation - Continuously optimize existing Data infrastructures - Ensure a technological watch - Being able to give trainings and manage partnerships, do advice - Have a good customer relationship You control the ecosystem Hadoop, Spark, Kafka and its integration into a corporate architecture. You have knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases. And a minimum of skills on ETL, so do not hesitate and join us. Why join us: - Evolve within a passionate team always on the lookout for a new technology to crunch the data - Have a blast developing POCs on the most popular Frameworks - Have dedicated time to contribute to Open-Source projects - Animate hands-on for internal and external events - Attend the best conferences (Devoxx, Hadoop Summit Europe, Berlin Buzzwords, ...) - Become a certified trainer for our partners (Confluent, DataStax, Couchbase, Lightbend, ...)
job_requirements: RequirementsMinimum 2 years experience in relevant role

seniority: Senior Management, Middle Management, Manager, Senior Executive
job_descriptions: Job Description: - Work in Strategic Technology Centre to deliver data analytic solution to customers/users (solutions range from Descriptive, Diagnostic. Predictive, Prescriptive to Machine Learning and AI in developing data models with algorithms for big data analytics.   - Develop hardcore data science techniques into algorithms for DA with ML/AI capabilities.
job_requirements: RequirementsRequirements: -     Prefer a Master's Degree or PHD in Science/Engineering/Mathematics with at least 2-3 years of working experience in data analytics.  -     In-depth technical knowledge in either: (1) Operational Research, (2) Computer Network (3) Computer Vision (4) Fluid Dynamics (5) Engineering Mechanics (6) Video/Image Processing (7) AI and Neural Network (7) Geometry and Topology (8) Social & Cognitive Computing is a plus. -     Good experience with end-to-end data profiling, mathematical modeling, testing, validation, algorithm, visualization / ideation and solutioning. -     Experienced in MySQL, Python, Matlab, Java or C. -     Knowledge of Hadoop and Spark highly essential in the age of Big Data.

job_descriptions: Responsibilities As a Lecturer, your contributions go beyond teaching and facilitating learning. You play a critical role in recognising and nurturing your students’ potential and their lifelong learning needs. In addition, you will carry out industry or consultancy projects to help you remain relevant in your profession and to evolving changes in industry, and maintain strong linkages with industry and schools. You will also have the opportunity to have industry attachments or experience on a regular basis to update your skills, knowledge and practices of your profession. Those with good and relevant experience can look forward to Senior Lecturer or equivalent positions, with career development opportunities to leadership positions in the Colleges or Headquarters.Requirements College Central   You should be trained in Electronics Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, IoT related subjects, with at least 3 years of relevant experience in design, develop and deployment of embedded firmware for IoT & Communication hardware and software.   You should be familiar in one or more of the following areas:  - roduct electronics design related to analogue, digital and power electronics - PCB Cad design software rules and routing - programming skills on C, C++ or python  - IoT/Cloud development and data visualization - electronics assembly and hardware     College East You should be trained in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Science and/or Analytics, with at least 3 years of relevant work experience to be able to develop students' skills in implementing IoT/software applications, including data analytics solutions. You should possess relevant experience in one or more of the following areas: - development of IoT applications - data analytics technologies and Big Data - proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R or similar (familiarity with Python-based libraries such as scikit-learn, numpy/scipy and pandas is preferred) - programming web and mobile applications would be advantageous

1 – 5 years of experience in Data Science or Data Analytics Have worked and deployed on technologies such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Hadoop, RDBMS, MongoDB, NoSQL, Hive, ETL, NLP, AI, ML and/or DL Experience with Python or C++ programming language. Experience with Big Data architectures will be advantageous Have passion and enthusiasm to master new technology Lateral thinking, passionate, innovative and creative. A highly motivated self-starter who possess positive mindset, a doer mentality, proactive and good communication skills Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
job_requirements: Requirements1 – 5 years of experience in Data Science or Data Analytics

job_titles: Senior Research Fellow (Institute of Data Science)
job_descriptions: The Senior Research Fellow will be responsible for undertaking in-depth research and innovation in data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence and big data that lead to publications in top-tier international conferences and journals, as well as real-world implementations. He/she will be working closely with the Principal Investigator and lab members on one or more research projects with external collaborators on interesting and challenging real-world datasets and problem statements.  He/she will also work with the Principal Investigator to develop new research programmes and craft new funding proposals, and assist in mentoring junior researchers and students in research projects. Responsibilities: ·         Develop and implement new concepts and algorithms in data science, machine learning and artificial intelligence ·         Research and be up-to-date on state-of-the-art methodologies in related technical fields and application domains ·         Assist in developing new research programmes and crafting funding proposals ·         Mentor and/or supervise junior researchers and students in research projects ·         Contribute to knowledge exchange and knowledge transfer activities with external partners and collaborators ·         Writing or contributing to publications for disseminating research findings ·         Develop demos and presentations for exhibiting work at appropriate events.
job_requirements: Requirements A PhD in Computer Science or equivalent, with specialization related to data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence, or databases; At least 3 years of postdoctoral research experience, as well as a demonstrated capability to achieve research excellence and develop research programmes and funding proposals; Computational thinking with proven ability to conduct independent research with a strong and relevant publication record; Experienced in working with a diverse range of data types using state-of-the-art machine learning and AI algorithms on big data platforms – prior experience in data analytics and machine learning for healthcare applications would be a plus; Excellent interpersonal communication and oral presentation skills in English; Experienced in mentoring and supervising students and junior researchers, and Experienced in working in a team, with people of diverse skillsets, including industry end-users

job_descriptions: We are looking for Data Engineers for Capgemini Singapore on renewable contracts : Contract period (renewable): 5X for 6 months renewable contract 5X for 12 months renewable contract To start soonest possible. 1 month notice period is fine. Competent in any 2 or more of the following technology:  RDBMS: Oracle, Postgres, MSSQL, Netezza ETL and Data Integration Tools: IBM Datastage, Pentaho, Talend, Attunity Big Data: Hadoop (Hortonworks), Hive QL, Spark, Sqoop, etc Programming and Scripting: Linux/Unix Shell Scripting, Java, Scala, Hive QL, PL/SQL, NoSQL BI Tools: PowerBI, Qlik

Experience in designing and developing dataware house solutions Hands on in managing data mapping, data quality and integrity, performance in data processing. Experience in insurance domain is an advantage Experience in Agile software development    Personal Traits  Proactive with can-do attitude Independent and self-motivated Able to work under pressure to meet tight timeline Able to provide regular updates

job_descriptions: Data Engineer Singapore DataRobot is looking for an experienced software engineer to join our team working on Big Data problems.  As a team member, you will work on building a data processing framework that allows the DataRobot application to scale to new heights. The ideal candidate should have experience in distributed computing and storage architectures and be able to think at scale.
job_requirements: Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field 5+ years experience building large scale, highly available, distributed computing systems 1+ years experience in Scala or Java  2+ years experience working in the Hadoop stack (HDFS, Yarn, ZooKeeper, etc.) 3+ years experience in Python. Fundamental knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and complexity analysis Ability to expertly design and produce high quality, high performance code ready to ship Hands on experience with Big Data technologies (e.g. Hadoop MapReduce, Spark, Hive, Vertica, Netezza, Greenplum, Aster) Familiarity with internals of distributed data processing engines such as Spark Ability to evaluate and optimize performance and scalability in the context of big data processing and storage. Experience working in GNU/Linux environments Understanding of software design principles and best practices (test driven development, source control management) Open minded, curious, and thorough. Proficient in English

companys: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
job_descriptions: As Manager in AIO - Value Drive Office (VDO), you will assist in planning, managing and implementing Health Informatics and data analytics for value driven outcome projects in NUHS. You will work closely with various departments to identify and/or support them to drive value creation in their current workflow. Job Responsibilities  Coordinate VDO projects’ activities and project meetings. Facilitate monthly meetings with Senior Management. Assign, track and monitor VDO team members in their project deliverable and timeliness of completion of key tasks. Conduct data and VDO dashboard verifications and consolidate VDO data for reporting purposes. Perform big data analysis, draw insights and engage stakeholders in providing possible solutions.
job_requirements: Requirements Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, Accounting or Statistics. At least 6 years of relevant experience in finance, auditing, analytics, or technology related field. Good interpersonal skills, a detail-oriented & flexible person who can work across different areas within the team. Proficient in the use of MS Excel (advance), Data Visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, IDEAs), SQL and Sharepoint. Strong analytical skills with an ability to apply business logic to design and implement data mining techniques on large data sets. Possess strong problem solving and critical thinking skills and comfortable to work in an ambiguity environment. Working knowledge of data mining and forecasting/predictive modeling tools and techniques will be preferred. Ability to deliver clear, concise reports and presentations/dashboards with an ability to effectively articulate observations and recommendations. Have a proven track record of building strong relationships with stakeholders at various levels. Can-do attitude and ability to work independently.

job_descriptions: About the Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg Successful candidate will work with a team to conduct exciting R&D on multimedia security, in one or more of the following areas: tampering detection, data hiding, security intelligence and analytics, pattern recognition, machine learning & analytics. Successful candidate will be involved in researching and developing advanced technologies and algorithms to detect, analyse, and assess data related to anomalies in image/audio/video signals.
job_requirements: Requirements    Minimum Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security or other related fields   Experienced in multimedia security, computer vision, image/video processing, machine learning will be a plus   Proficient in at least one programming language of Python, C, C++ and Matlab   Highly motivated, resourceful, with good attitude   Ability to deliver under tight schedules   Good interpersonal, presentation and communication skills   The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualisation solutions. For more information about I²R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg ﻿We are looking for a highly-motivated and skilled research engineer to work on real-world text data analysis, processing and classificaiton.   He/she will work with a team of scientists with core responsibilities to fulfill research tasks and deliverables.  He/she will learn the state of- the-art in the relevant research fields and have the opportunity to solve real-world challenging problems in the medical data domain.

job_titles: Instructor in Interactive Media Design (Educator Track)
job_descriptions: Instructor in Interactive Media Design (Educator Track) The Department of Communications and New Media at National University of Singapore is looking to fill the following Educator Track (teaching only) positions. We seek applicants with expertise in data science, interactive media design and software studies. The applicant will have (industry related and/or teaching) experience in one or more of the following areas:  Data analytics, big data, data visualisation, and use of software tools such as R and Python, and web technologies. Computational media and communication, and artificial intelligence Game studies User interface, user experience and HCI design  Responsibilities: Successful candidates must have a Masters’ degree or a closely affiliated discipline by the appointment of start date and a record of excellence in teaching in large comprehensive universities. The candidate must also have approximately 2 years of teaching experience. A passion for working closely with students and a commitment to student learning are essential. Successful candidates are also expected to have experience with online teaching and the development of MOOCs. The successful candidate is expected to teach 5 modules per academic year. Other duties include supervision of honours students and graduate students, and administrative service. The anticipated start date is 1 July prior to the beginning of the semester in August 2019. For further enquiries, please email: cnmbox15@nus.edu.sg
job_requirements: RequirementsInterested parties must submit the following documents, in an email clearly indicating the position they are applying for, to Ms Jasmin Tay at cnmbox15@nus.edu.sg:  NUS Personal Particulars Form (http://www.fas.nus.edu.sg/cnm/images/Brochures/Personal-Particulars-Form.pdf) NUS Personal Data Consent Form for Job Applicants (http://www.nus.edu.sg/careers/files/NUS-Personal-Data-Consent-for-Job-Applicants.pdf) Academic History: certificates of degrees obtained, scholarships and awards. Employment History: Full CV, including education, professional background, teaching and supervision, research activities and achievements, honours and awards, and service accomplishments to date. List all academic and non-academic positions. Copies of Academic Degree Certificates obtained Teaching Portfolio: 	 A preface (maximum 300 words) that makes the case for your appointment. This should be highly distilled summary of your key contributions to student learning and educational leadership, guided by your teaching philosophy. A Teaching Statement that focuses on evidence of student learning and educational leadership (if applicable). Note that the Teaching Statement, together with documents on research (where applicable) and service contributions should be no more than a maximum of 3,000 words.   Documents on research, where applicable. Note that the documents on research (together with the Teaching Statement and documents on service contributions) should be no more than a maximum of 3,000 words. Teaching evaluations and peer review reports, if available. Other evidence of teaching excellence and/or other contributions to education e.g. curriculum development, pedagogical innovation, etc. should be provided. If applicable, a complete list of publications, grouped according to papers, books, and reviews, including page numbers, in bibliographic form. Documents on service contributions. List and elaborate on the impact of service to department/faculty/university, international academic community, and/or national and international agencies. Note that the documents on research (together with the Teaching Statement and documents on service contributions) should be no more than a maximum of 3,000 words. Teaching evaluations and peer review reports, if available. Other evidence of teaching excellence and/or other contributions to education e.g. curriculum development, pedagogical innovation, etc. should be provided. THREE letters of reference to be arranged by the applicant to be submitted directly by the referees at cnmbox15@nus.edu.sg.  For full consideration, please submit a complete application, including letters of recommendation, by 3 May 2019. Applications received after this date may be considered until the position is filled. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Enquiries may be directed to cnmbox15@nus.edu.sg. Further information about working at the National University of Singapore is available at http://www.nus.edu.sg/careers/whyjoinus.htm.   Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. The review will continue until the job is filled.

job_descriptions: The School of Business (SBIZ) at Singapore University of Social Sciences aims to educate business minds and in the process, transform the lives of our students when they graduate with a business degree. SBIZ currently has more than 4,000 students enrolled in various degree programmes.   Our students are mainly working adults who are keen to upgrade and remain competitive in the fast-paced business world. We also have a sizable group of full-time students pursuing their degree education full time in the University. To equip our students for a better future, we provide them with a curriculum that is industry-relevant and we adopt innovative and practice-oriented pedagogical approaches (e.g. case study, flipped-classroom). Classes are interactive in nature and instructors go beyond lectures and facilitate interactive discussions and activities that require application of theories to solve real world problems. As most of our students are working, they are able to apply what they have learnt in the classroom to real-life scenarios in their workplace almost immediately. This enables them to live out our maxim - Learn Today, Apply Tomorrow.   SBIZ is now recruiting passionate full-time faculty members who are aligned with our education aspirations. The responsibilities of SBIZ full-time faculty members include teaching and developing courses, conducting academic and/or applied research, and managing degree programmes and projects. We are interested in candidates in the following areas:    Accountancy (especially in the areas of Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, Assurance, Taxation, Business Valuation and Accounting Theory)  Analytics (especially in the areas of Machine Learning, Data Mining, Text Mining, Statistics, Forecasting, Optimisation, Data Visualisation, Data Management, IoT and Big Data) Business Law Entrepreneurship  Finance Information Systems Project Management Quality Management Supply Chain Management (especially in the areas of Procurement and International Trade  System) Strategy Operations Management Customer Relationship Management Business excellence (especially in the area of SPRING Singapore's Business Excellence framework)
job_requirements: Requirements Ph.D. degree holder in a relevant discipline. Ph.D candidates nearing completion will also be considered. Candidate with teaching and/or working experience in the relevant area will have an added advantage. In the area of Finance, candidates with a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) qualification or those in the area of Fintech, crytocurrency and digital banking will have an added advantage. In the area of Accountancy, candidates with a Chartered Accountant of Singapore qualification (or equivalent professional qualification) and at least a Master's degree in a relevant area will also be considered.  In the area of Business Law, candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Law and at least 5 years of relevant working experience will also be considered.    For more information and application, please visit our website: http://www.suss.edu.sg/careers/appointments-vacancies/Pages/Academic-Appointments-(Full-time).aspx (Only shortlisted candidates will be notified)

Candidate with teaching and/or working experience in the relevant area will have an added advantage. In the area of Finance, candidates with a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) qualification or those in the area of Fintech, crytocurrency and digital banking will have an added advantage. In the area of Accountancy, candidates with a Chartered Accountant of Singapore qualification (or equivalent professional qualification) and at least a Master's degree in a relevant area will also be considered.  In the area of Business Law, candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Law and at least 5 years of relevant working experience will also be considered.    For more information and application, please visit our website: http://www.suss.edu.sg/careers/appointments-vacancies/Pages/Academic-Appointments-(Full-time).aspx (Only shortlisted candidates will be notified)

job_titles: GIS - Bioinformatics Specialist / Senior Bioinformatics Specialist
job_descriptions: We are seeking a candidate for the role of data collection from diverse domains, analysis and translating findings into actionable insights, enabling wet bench scientists to perform validations.  The successful candidate also explores data from multiple omic platforms to gain insights through integrative analysis that give the lab a competitive edge by elucidating novel biological mechanisms, uncovering new therapeutic targets or potentially useful biomarkers for biomedical applications.  The individual finds opportunities in enabling and accelerating large-scale research activities using Big Data and cloud computing.
job_requirements: Requirements Bachelor or Master degree in Computational Biology/Bioinformatics/Statistics or a related discipline Good understanding in cancer biology, next-generation sequencing (NGS), UNIX and statistics/machine learning Possess knowledge in using public databases and tools and have hands-on experience in designing, implementing IT solutions using high performance computing or any public cloud environment (Amazon Web Services will be preferred) Significant experience in programming in R, python, BASH and those with experience in software for IVD compliance/validation and ISO3485 will be a plus Able to communicate effectively and work in cross-functional teams Strong self-motivation and driven to work in a startup environment    The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_descriptions: The selected candidate will join the Risk Policy & Analytics team. Reporting to the Head of Risk Policy & Analytics, this position is responsible for innovation and critical thinking with deliverables relating to SGX risk management policies.  We are looking for bright individual who is able to work in a group and build relationships within SGX and with the industry as a whole.   Key Accountabilities      Coding, code control, testing, “big-data” and data visualization.  Develop, test and deploy risk tools in-line with end user development roadmap led by Risk policy   Collaborate with internal and external stake holders to deliver projects   Assist in architecting and building out infrastructure to facilitate risk visualization and quant work.    Position Deliverables    The candidate is expected to:  Have strong hands-on experience with development using Python. Ability to work on individual projects as well as contribute to development projects taken up by the team. Good understanding of software development life-cycle, documentation and governance requirement. Familiarity with different type of databases, including time-series databases. Experience with different tools for visualization of large data sets like Tableau, Qlikview, Plotly etc Comfortable using source control systems (GIT) and ensure that the practices are in line with best practices, Assist in setting up test cases and debugging of code, and Assist in architecting and building out infrastructure to facilitate risk visualization and quant work.
job_requirements: Requirements Degree (or comparable experience) in computer science, engineering, mathematics or statistics. We are looking for experience of programming, preferably in Python. Coding experience from languages other than Python (we also have some R and Java codes) is welcomed and a suitable candidate would embrace new tools and languages. Proven coding skills is a definite plus, either from previous work experience and/or open source contributions. Ability to work with “big-data”, and preference for someone with system architectural experience from working in a quant shop. The applicant should be able to estimate how the code and architecture would scale as number of input factors grows and throughput is increased. Ability to work with a modern tool stack, and also motivate and drive other team members towards better practises. Current tool stack includes the use of GIT and Python, but an applicant should be open to continuously improvements. Familiarity with financial markets and risk is a plus but not an absolute requirement. Fluent with both written and verbal communication.                                            Essential Attributes   Curious personality and is eager to learn new things. The ability to have a high level view as well as drive to dive down to deepest level of an issue to understand root cause is essential. Positive attitude and willingness to change. Coding competency in Python. Understanding of databases.

job_descriptions: COMPANY DESCRIPTION  NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives.  RESPONSIBILITIES  As Senior Cloud Database Admin, you will design and develop database structures and schemas, analyze client workflow, determine the best solutions for a successful project, and share knowledge of database, big data or data analytics. As a part of the team, you will help the teams adopt to cloud native database solutions. To be successful in this role the candidate must have deep knowledge cloud data technologies and align technology solutions to specific business objectives. As Senior Cloud Database Admin you will:  Automate the build, operation, backup, restore, and monitoring of databases used across NTUC Develop and evaluate database infrastructure performance criteria and measurement methods Support day-to-day operations and management of an enterprise level production database in the cloud Monitors user access and performance of the database systems Create best practices for cloud database operations Participation in maintenance windows and on-call rotation is required Contributing to other support and automation efforts as needed
job_requirements: Requirements Minimum of 10 Years of relevant work experience required Very strong and solid experience of database administration in a cloud environment. Experience with replication/clustering and partitioning a must Experience writing and executing stress tests on databases and services Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database problems Very good Knowledge of indexes, index management, statistics, data-at-rest encryption, secure connectivity Experience with Big Data concepts and technologies, especially using AWS or GCP (ex: MongoDB, Redshift, etc.) Experience with cloud database technologies (ex: AWS RDS, Redshift, DynamoDB, MS SQL, etc.)

job_descriptions: COMPANY DESCRIPTION NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives. RESPONSIBILITIES The Analytics Centre transforms big data into actionable insights which enable the SEs to make decision that directly impact the outcomes of their business.   By identifying patterns and building models that help to interpret and predict the behaviors of different customer segments, we will uncover opportunities for partners to grow their business through more effective marketing, better product development and stronger customer engagement.  We are on the lookout for talented individuals to join us as BI / Business Analyst. This role will work very closely with the Business Insights team, which is responsible for development and delivery of Business Insights solutions to the organization. Responsibilities:  Work as part of the Analytics team to develop analytical solutions, most frequently in the form of data visualizations and interactive dashboards Create, schedule, and monitor server-based BI activities such as data extracts and refreshes Define, populate, and maintain user groups and user access within analytical tools Audit reporting performance and optimize when necessary Assist in performing and testing to deploy dashboards in production Assist in user adoption and enablement activities such as delivering training sessions or writing instructional content for BI tools Understand business goals and drivers and translate those into appropriate analytics solutions
job_requirements: Requirements Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field 3+ years of experience in BI engineering Retail Experience is a plus Strong understanding of Tableau Architecture required to perform effectively (Tableau Certified is preferred) Understanding and Experience in using Level of Detail, Set Actions, Context Filters, order of operations (aka query pipeline) in Tableau Good Visualisation Skills, Ability to present insights in a Story Proficient in SQL - Knowledge of databases like Amazon Redshift, snowflake etc. and performance tuning techniques. Knowledge of data warehousing and data modeling Strong analytical problem-solving ability Self-starter with the ability to work independently or as part of a project team Ability to understand customer needs and drive impactful business outcomes

job_descriptions: About the Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg The Deep Learning 2.0 program is a multi-year A*STAR Al program, focused on capturing the Next wave of deep learning. The program is focused on    10x open problems in deep learning algorithmic research: thrusts include learning with 10 x fewer labelled samples, incorporating knowledge graphs into deep learning, online deep learning, and white-box deep learning. Next generation hardware for deep learning: we are looking beyond GPUs and TPUs, and reimagining the entire hardware stack for deep learning from algorithms all the way down to silicon New emerging enterprise applications for deep learning: ranging from personalized medicine, finance, health-care, 10T and advanced semiconductor manufacturing.    We are looking for a researcher, with have experience at least in one of the following topics: A. GANs in speech / vision / language B. Bayesian learning, Causal Inference C. Lifelong learning: from concepts to tasks D. Knowledge graphs E. Bottom-up reasoning G. Innovative ideas to tackle the YouTube8M data set H. Multimodal Q&A Systems I. Game theory J. Optimization techniques K. Active Deep Learning   The researcher should be able to conceptualize ambitious R&D programs working with other researchers in DL2.  The skills should be complementary to the existing knowhow of the existing DL2 unit, whose scope is briefly described below.
job_requirements: Requirements   Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, or Data Science intensive fields, with expertise in one or more of the following areas: 	  Large-scale machine learning   Deep learning, supervised or unsupervised   Applying state-of-the-art machine learning techniques to practical problems in different domains    Experience in corporate or application oriented environments is a plus. Ability to work independently, as well as in teams highly desired. Good communication skills for proposals, reports, and publications Experience with one of Tensor Flow, Theano, Caffe, CNTK. Skills Strong programming abilities (e.g. Perl, Bash, C/C++, Java, Python, R, MATLAB) Computer vision and deep learning skills desirable  The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_descriptions: About Isentia Isentia is the Asia-Pacific region's leading media intelligence company; we're a client-centric organization where you can really add value to our clients' businesses.   Our clients are diverse, ranging from globally renowned brands right through to start-ups and not for profit organisations.   We provide our team members with constructive feedback to foster their career growth, and you will have many opportunities to work with fun and talented people.  We also have an open and inclusive culture where we embrace opportunities to do better and we celebrate achievements wildly. We offer an opportunity to work with a great team of talented, innovative and passionate people across the Asia-Pacific and access to our innovative search technology, comprehensive coverage and expert research. We also offer a competitive salary and a heap of benefits!   Job description At Isentia, we are passionate about helping communicators understand media, data and content. This starts with our Tech team working with the latest cloud platforms and machine learning algorithms to collect data, analyse it and inform our customer on the issues important to them.   Our Software  Engineering team in Singapore is looking for Senior Software Engineers. Ideally, full-stack engineer (Nodejs/ Express or Python/ Flask, Angular 6 and Typescript). You have experience in developing APIs, micro services and integrating them with responsive Single Page Applications. To be successful in this role you will require a good experience in AWS, DevOps, CI/CD, and TDD. It‘s a really great time to join our software engineering team. We are agile and lean in our delivery approach. We run regular hackathon and blitz days. We stay ahead of the technology curve – Kubernetes, Apache Spark, Tensorflow you name it. This is an exceptional opportunity for someone who wants to really make a difference to our teams and clients by delivering solutions that truly meet the business needs and requirements.   Responsibilities:  working within an agile environment as part of a cross-functional collaborative team develop new products features involving front end as well as back end interactively and incrementally  implement integration with big data, natural language processing and machine learning services collaborating your team and product owner to perform task breakdown, estimation, and prioritization.  ensure that you are meeting our development standards and delivering high-quality software.
job_requirements: Requirements You’re an experienced Senior Software Engineer/ Software Engineer with strong exposure in building high-throughput digital and data platforms. You have strong experience with at-least two of the following technologies: Nodejs and Express, Python and Flask, Angular 6 and Typescript. You have developed high-quality pixel perfect and highly aesthetic UI implementation to meet business needs and requirements You have a background in software engineering, strong experience with data structures and design patterns. You come from a cloud-native DevOps environment with a focus on highly available and scalable applications. You know how to build software with support for HA, scalability, fault tolerance and security. You are a team player with great communication skills who thrive working with people with diverse background.    If you worked as a Senior Software Engineer what would you have done last week?  Developed new APIs, microservices, and UI components and deployed multiple times in Production via our Continuous delivery process. Wrote automated unit tests, performance tests, and worked on various strategies to improve the quality of the software we deliver. Learned something new – for instance how to speed up your development workflow using Docker and Kubernetes or codify your build process. You mentored and coached junior software engineers in your squad; participated in various internal guilds and alliance meetings.    If you are interested in this role, then please send in your resume together with your salary expectation and notice period to Carrie.Lim@isentia.com now! We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

job_descriptions: Are you passionate about open source software? We want to meet you today! We are looking for a software developer to contribute to the design of a fully working reference implementation of Ocean Protocol. You will be working with a team to implement a vibrant ecosystem of Open Source data services that can be used to create trusted, decentralised supply chains for Big Data and AI. Ocean Protocol is designed for scale and uses blockchain technology that allows data to be shared and sold in a safe, secure and transparent manner.   Your new role:  Support the evolution of the Ocean Protocol in tandem with the reference implementation through public Ocean Enhancement Proposals (OEPs) Develop the working Ocean Reference Implementation according to the specified OEPs Ensure the decentralised Ocean Network V1 launch is fully compatible with the reference implementation Engage effectively with other Ocean development teams to ensure development and implementation is in line with the overall objectives and goals Support usage of the Reference Implementation by partners and early adopters of the Ocean Protocol  To read more about Ocean Protocol, and the full technical, business and marketplace whitepapers, please visit https://oceanprotocol.com/
job_requirements: RequirementsWho you are:  Strong experience with Big Data, data engineering, and cloud-based data services Previous working experience as a software developer for data solutions Experience in Agile / iterative product development Passion for Open Source technology with a track record of strong open source contributions Strong technical communication skills  Your technical skill set:  Degree in computer science, engineering or a similar field Experience in software architecture and API / protocol design 5+ years software development experience with a focus on back-end API development Experience with Java, Python and/or Clojure application development

job_descriptions: Who are we: Hubble is a technology startup focused on revolutionising the Construction Industry. The Construction industry undertakes the world’s largest, most expensive, and complex projects ever dreamt of by mankind. Yet, the Construction industry is notoriously slow to adopt new technologies and as a result, there exists a large amount of inefficiencies and problems that Hubble can create positive value and make a great impact on. This impacts the homes people live in, offices people work in, and cities generations live in. There is no other industry where technology can have a greater impact. Bar none. Hubble’s vision is to build the pillars of trust for the Construction industry and we are on a mission to develop the autonomous self-building construction sites of tomorrow - powered by big data, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.. Our first step to our mission is to track the Man, Machine, Material, and Money (4M) data - for the Construction industry. The 4M data can be used to optimise operations at the worksites as well as to build an automated trading platform for the 4M. We have grown rapidly to become the market leader in each of the 4M verticals: 1. Man: We have more than 10,000 construction workers (~5% market share) on Hubble's platform and have tracked more than 35 million man-hours in total. 2. Machine: We track more than 1.5 million machinery transactions/year and have >US$100 million worth of machinery on Hubble's platform today. 3. Material: We developed Hubble Maps (Patent Pending) for precise indoor material and man tracking. We were awarded BCA's Innovation Grant 2018 and presented our technology to DPM Teo Chee Hean. 4. Money: We are deployed at iconic projects such as Project Jewel, Paya Lebar Quarters, Gardens by the Bay, and City Gate and have tracked more than $1 billion in project value. Interesting fact: We have grown rapidly without any venture funding to become the market leader in this space in less than 1 year. Our partners include the largest and most prestigious Construction companies such as Woh Hup, Lum Chang, Hexacon, Erect Group, Koh Kock Leong Enterprise, Chuan Lim Construction, and OAS Painting and Construction. We have also built the best engineering, product, and business team comprising the best and brightest of Singapore. We are a collegial set up and are extremely collaborative. We are hiring aggressively and are looking for motivated, smart, driven, and resourceful people to join our team. Who will you be working with: If you connect with any of the description below, please apply immediately:  Purpose driven Hungry, ambitions, and self-motivated Meritocratic, results/performance > age/bureaucracy Resourceful, independent, chart our own destiny Determined, perseverance, and hard working Creative, innovative, out of the box  Yes, the above is everyone of us at Hubble. What will you be doing:  Developing a clean and maintainable code using software engineering best-practices and modern platforms. Leading full product development lifecycle from ideation to live production Day-to-day tech operations such as server maintenance and deployment.
job_requirements: RequirementsWhat skill sets do you need:  Have a good understanding of web application architecture (REST & JWT) Experience in implementing various software engineering design patterns Good working knowledge in one or more of these frameworks: Ruby on Rails, AngularJS, ReactJS, and React Native Familiar with Git Experience in DevOps and in building scalable products will be an added advantage. Comfortable with working in a fast-paced environment and highly collaborative team to solve real business problems Versatility and enthusiasm to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward Applicants with leadership qualities will be an added benefit

job_descriptions: Apply statistical tools/models to perform advanced data analytics, identify key underlying drivers for growing customer engagement and business opportunities, and recommend a clear action plan going forward. Develop and implement artificial intelligence algorithms, rules and rapid prototypes from big data sets that will be fed into various business programs. Behavioral segmentation based on customer journey, profiles, transaction patterns, and app activities that will lead to highly personalized customer insights. Perform deep-dive analysis to solve various business problems arising from marketing, dynamic incentive programs, and campaign management. Build and automate intuitive dashboards that help visualize and answer complex business problems
job_requirements: Requirements B.S. or master’s or equivalent degree in Statistics, Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Engineering or equivalent quantitative, Data management fields preferred. At least 5 years’ experience in industry (consumer banking, telecoms, retail) analytics and reporting using various analytical tools Strong programming skills using analytics tools, programming experience in SQL, SAS, Tableau Experience of developing MIS dashboards and knowledge of Qlikview / development. Experience of data analysis, translating business requirements into source system data attribute identification, logical data model solution development and mapping the data attributes. Sound understanding of data models and knowledge of various data warehouse technologies Good understanding of technology tools especially those related to analytics, data & reporting business MIS Good written and oral communication skills
